title: Uncontrolled components are inputs that do not have a
value
c
property. In opposite to controlled components, it is the application’s responsibility to keep the component state and the input value in sync.

inline_content.Text: Uncontrolled components are inputs that do not have a
property. In opposite to controlled components, it is the application’s responsibility to keep the component state and the input value in sync.

title: Here, the component’s state is updated via the
onChange
c
event handler, just as for controlled components. However, instead of a
value
c
property, a
defaultValue
c

property is supplied. This determines the initial value of the input during the first render. Any subsequent changes to the component’s state are not automatically reflected by the input value; If this is required, a controlled component should be used instead.
